STM: Struggling with the workload of college courses, especially in Computer Science and Calculus
Feeling overwhelmed by the fast pace and high expectations of college life

MTM.Summary: Struggling with the demands of college coursework.
MTM.Patterns: Difficulty with Computer Science, Calculus, high expectations
MTM.Goals: Improve time management, seek academic help
MTM.Transition: Transitioning from high school to college life.

short_term: Complete all required coursework with at least a B average
Attend tutoring sessions for Computer Science and Calculus
long_term: Secure an internship in a tech-related field
Develop proficiency in at least two programming languages

STM: Made a couple of friends in class, finding some comfort in social connections
Feeling disconnected from high school friends due to the rapid change in lifestyle

MTM.Summary: Navigating social connections in a new environment.
MTM.Patterns: Making new friends, feeling disconnected from old friends
MTM.Goals: Build new relationships, maintain old ones
MTM.Transition: Adapting to the rapid change in lifestyle.

LTM.Lessons: New environments offer new opportunities, change is inevitable

short_term: Join at least two campus clubs or groups
Schedule weekly calls with family and old friends
long_term: Build a supportive network of friends and mentors

STM: Experiencing the stress of college life, including early mornings and late-night disturbances
Dealing with existential thoughts and feelings of not belonging

MTM.Summary: Feeling stressed by college life and existential concerns.
MTM.Patterns: Stress from workload, existential thoughts, feeling out of place
MTM.Goals: Manage stress, find a sense of belonging
MTM.Transition: Adjusting to new responsibilities and self-identity.

LTM.Implications: Recognizing the importance of mental health.
LTM.Lessons: Self-care is essential, seek support when needed

short_term: Find a counselor or therapist for regular sessions
long_term: Develop a sustainable routine for physical and mental health
Achieve a balanced lifestyle that includes time for relaxation and hobbies

STM: Realization of the high cost of living in NYC, particularly with expenses like coffee
Feeling broke due to the demands of college life and urban living

MTM.Summary: Realizing the high cost of living in NYC.

short_term: Create and stick to a monthly budget
Apply for scholarships or part-time jobs
long_term: Save enough for a semester abroad or summer program
Begin investing in a retirement fund

STM: Questioning if anyone is truly happy or just pretending
Feeling like college isn't matching up to the expectations of freedom and fun

MTM.Summary: Questioning societal norms and personal expectations.
MTM.Patterns: Doubt about happiness, mismatch between expectations and reality
MTM.Transition: Shifting from idealism to realism in college life.

LTM.Implications: Acknowledging the complexity of personal fulfillment.
LTM.Lessons: Happiness is subjective, societal norms can be questioned

short_term: Read at least one book on philosophy or personal development each month
Journal weekly about personal growth and philosophical insights
long_term: Develop a personal philosophy that guides life choices
Contribute to discussions or writings on societal norms and personal fulfillment

STM: Frustrated with coding assignments, particularly in Java
Struggling to find enjoyment in programming

MTM.Patterns: Frustration with Java, lack of enjoyment in programming
MTM.Goals: Improve coding skills, find motivation in tech
MTM.Transition: Moving from enthusiasm to frustration in tech learning.

short_term: Complete a small coding project outside of coursework
long_term: Gain a solid understanding of software development principles
Create or contribute to an open-source project
